title: Enhancing Patient Care Practical Skills: Financial Risk Management Learning Through Corporate Bankruptcy Case Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can analyze corporate bankruptcy cases to identify key failure factors such as high-cost structures, declining profitability, and debt management failures
Learners can apply mathematical models to assess corporate financial vulnerabilities through financial ratio analysis and cash flow forecasting
Learners can propose strategic alternatives to mitigate financial risks based on case study findings
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
